title: EHS Compliance Platform - Ensuring Worker Safety for Global Manufacturing
role: **My Role**: Lead Business Analyst, responsible for requirements gathering, backlog management, API documentation, and stakeholder communication.
description: An EHS platform for a global manufacturing client serving 50,000+ employees.

problemStatement.context: A global manufacturing giant (50k+ employees) was relying on disparate legacy systems and spreadsheets to manage Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) incidents. This fragmentation led to delayed reporting, inconsistent data, and increased compliance risk.
goals: Unify EHS data into a single platform
problemStatement.constraints: Strict regulatory deadlines, integration with legacy HR systems, multi-language support required.

research.summary: Led global discovery sessions with stakeholders from Europe, Asia, and North America to understand local compliance nuances.
insights: Field workers needed a mobile-first interface.
EHS managers needed real-time dashboards, not monthly reports.

outcomes.reflection: **What I Learned**: This project taught me the importance of early API contract testing. By implementing it, we caught integration issues a full sprint earlier than usual.

title: Automotive QMS Suite - Streamlining PPAP & Non-Conformity for Volvo & PACCAR
role: **My Role**: Business Analyst & Product Owner Proxy, managing the backlog for the Quality Management System modules.
description: A comprehensive Quality Management System (QMS) ensuring parts meet strict automotive standards.

problemStatement.context: The client's Production Part Approval Process (PPAP) and Non-Conformity Report (NCR) workflows were manual and email-driven, causing delays in part approval and production bottlenecks.
goals: Provide real-time visibility into supplier quality
problemStatement.constraints: Must integrate with SAP, strict audit trail requirements.

research.summary: Mapped existing 'as-is' processes using BPMN and identified 15+ bottlenecks in the manual workflow.
insights: Supplier communication was the biggest bottleneck.
Approvers were overwhelmed by irrelevant notifications.

outcomes.reflection: Standardizing the process before digitizing it was key. We eliminated 3 redundant approval steps before writing a line of code.

title: AI-Powered Risk Detection - Proactively Identifying Compliance Risks
role: **My Role**: Technical Business Analyst, bridging the gap between Data Science and Engineering.
description: Integrating machine learning to predict and prevent compliance breaches.

problemStatement.context: A key automotive client's compliance team was struggling to manually monitor thousands of daily operational activities. This reactive process meant risks were often identified after the fact.
problemStatement.constraints: Model explainability was crucial for trust.

research.summary: Collaborated with data scientists to define feature sets and with compliance officers to understand risk indicators.
insights: False positives were more acceptable than false negatives, but had to be minimized.

metrics: Improved early risk detection accuracy by 20%
Reduced manual review time by 15 hours/week
outcomes.reflection: Data quality is the foundation of AI. We spent 40% of the time just cleaning and validating the input data.

title: Executive Dashboards - Visualizing Impact for Decision Makers
description: Building a suite of Power BI and Superset dashboards to track KPI performance.

problemStatement.context: Executive leadership lacked real-time visibility into EHS and Quality metrics, relying on stale monthly PPT reports.
problemStatement.constraints: Data privacy regulations (GDPR) for employee data.

research.summary: Interviewed 10+ executives to understand their key questions and decision-making criteria.
insights: Executives care about trends, not just snapshots.

metrics: 10% increase in customer satisfaction due to faster issue resolution
outcomes.reflection: Visual design matters in data. A clean, intuitive dashboard gets used; a cluttered one gets ignored.

title: OEM Integration APIs - Connecting the Supply Chain
description: Designing and documenting REST APIs for seamless data exchange with OEMs.

problemStatement.context: Data exchange between the client and their OEMs was done via fragile file transfers, leading to data loss and sync errors.
problemStatement.constraints: Legacy OEM systems with limited API capabilities.

research.summary: Analyzed existing file formats and mapped them to JSON schemas.
insights: Error handling and retry logic were critical due to unstable network connections at some factory sites.

metrics: Cut onboarding time for new OEMs by 50%
outcomes.reflection: Documentation is a product. High-quality Swagger docs drastically reduced the support burden on our team.
